Class Configurator

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public boolean load(java.lang.Object object,
                    java.io.File file)
        Peels the object's data into a "default" file configuration, then reads the file's config data layered over the existing default file configuration. The resulting "customized default" is then applied to the object. Finally the end result is re-written back to the file (for example new keys or changed restrictions)
        Parameters:
        object - the object representing this config
        file - the file to read/write from
        Returns:
        returns true if the operation was successful. Otherwise false is returned and an exception is printed.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.Object object,
                  java.io.File file)
           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Write the object's data to a file
        Parameters:
        object - the object representing this config
        file - the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - file crap
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - reflection crap
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - shouldnt happen
        java.lang.Throwable

      • read

        public void read(java.lang.Object object,
                 java.io.File file)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Read the file into the objects variables
        Parameters:
        object - the object
        file - the file to read
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - the file doesnt exist or is something other than a file
        java.io.IOException - more file crap
        InvalidConfigurationException - your yaml is yack, not to be confused with yack, which is probably some language now.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - reflection crap
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - shouldnt happen (probably)
        java.lang.Exception

      • stick

        public void stick(ConfigWrapper fc,
                  java.lang.Object object)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Stick the file configurations values into the given object
        Parameters:
        fc - the file config
        object - the object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - shouldnt happen unless you are doing dumb crap like player variables without keydefs
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - really shouldnt happen
        java.lang.Exception

      • peel

        public ConfigWrapper peel(java.lang.Object object)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Peels the objects variables into a file configuration. If you use Key annotations, it will run this method in exclusive mode, ignoring any variable without a key object. Using a blank key annotation will default to the variable name as the config ref. One underscore represents a dash, and two represents a dot in the key (indent)
        Parameters:
        object - the object
        Returns:
        the file configuration peeled off the object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - shoudlnt happen unless you are doing dumb shit.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - shouldnt happen
        java.lang.SecurityException - yeah...
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - ....
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - .....
        java.lang.InstantiationException - .............
        java.lang.Exception
